Class Medias

  • java.lang.Object

      • play.mvc.Controller
        • controllers.Medias
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    play.mvc.Http.HeaderNames, play.mvc.Http.Status

    public class Medias
extends play.mvc.Controller
    Controller that handles the different API action applied to the media

    olivie_a

    • Method Detail

      • medias

        public static play.mvc.Result medias(java.lang.String accessToken)
        List all the available media.
        Returns:
        An HTTP Json response containing the properties of all the media

      • add

        public static play.mvc.Result add(java.lang.String ownerEventToken,
                  java.lang.String accessToken)
        Add one or several medias into an event. The medias properties are contained into the HTTP Request body as Json format.
        Parameters:
        ownerEventToken - : The id of the event that will contain the medias
        Returns:
        An HTTP Json response containing the properties of all the added media

      • delete

        public static play.mvc.Result delete(java.lang.Integer id,
                     java.lang.String accessToken)
        Delete the media identified by the id parameter.
        Parameters:
        id - : the media identifier
        Returns:
        An HTTP response that specifies if the deletion succeeded or not

      • update

        public static play.mvc.Result update(java.lang.Integer id,
                     java.lang.String accessToken)
        Update the media identified by the id parameter. The new media properties are contained into the HTTP Request body as Json format.
        Parameters:
        id - : the media identifier
        Returns:
        An HTTP Json response containing the new properties of edited media

      • media

        public static play.mvc.Result media(java.lang.Integer id,
                    java.lang.String accessToken)
        Get the properties of the media identified by the id parameter.
        Parameters:
        id - : the media identifier
        Returns:
        An HTTP Json response containing the properties of the specified media
